pros: Great culture and work environment
cons: investments are cut and dry in terms of deal flow and analysis

pros: There was a lot of young people
cons: have to live in Iowa

pros: Nice work environment; good culture.
cons: Like any job, long hours.

pros: Great corporate direction and earnings
cons: Globally limited by EU regulations

pros: Innovative work environment, good employee engagement practices, competitive wages
cons: Financial services industry is not terribly compassionate -- Aviva selected one family each year to whom to extend corporate compassion, but largely see people as accounts
advice_to_mgmt: Stay focused on producing financial results

pros: The colleagues are pretty great
cons: Management does not seem to know what they are doing.

pros: A great company to work for. My work was appreciated by upper management and my co-workers were very great people to work with.
cons: Usual politics but the benefits and perks outweigh these.

pros: Autonomy. Ability to work with various technologies. Education and development opportunities widely available. Good atmosphere with co-workers. Fair severance.
cons: Like anywhere there are tough times and emergencies. Just do your best to manage through them. Like anywhere, directives can come from the top that adversely impact you regardless of personal performance.
advice_to_mgmt: Obviously the merger was a big change. In retrospect, it does not look like it was a wise decision by senior management. However, that probably should have been seen on the front end.

review_title: Athene destroyed this perfectly good company
pros: Culture and environment were committed to greatness
cons: Athene purchased and dumped outstanding talent
advice_to_mgmt: All companies are run by people and you forgot that when $$$ over people

pros: friendly staff, cares for employees
cons: can't think of any now

pros: Great place to work.great people
cons: cannot think of any..its a great co

pros: Great ethics, work life balance, flexibility. Great career opportunities. Highly professional and skilled work base.
cons: You have to fight for your own career, there is no career mentorship.

pros: Regional CEO (former) had good vision and insight
cons: Constant change of direction from UK management

pros: The work environment in the Des Moines office was very productive and supportive; not sure how things changed after the company was bought by Athene.
cons: Aviva Investors made too many strategic changes every year -- driven by the head office in London. Hopefully, this is no longer a nagging issue.
advice_to_mgmt: Do not interfere too much at every step. There is no need for strategic changes every year. Perhaps a strategic change should be done no more frequently than every 5 years.

pros: Very talented staff, willing to invest in all aspects of the business, very customer focused
cons: Big and complicated, fair amount of bureaucracy

pros: There was room for advancement depending on the location you were at.
cons: Takeover and acquisitions made working there stressful.
advice_to_mgmt: Make sure to include everyone, even people who work remotely, in all meetings and discussions.

pros: Good, friendly, good office, work life balance
cons: didnt pay much and projects are not too excited

pros: The salary was good for the area and competitive within is localized market. Raises were often modest and bonuses were decent.
cons: The company was going through some growing pains which meant budget cuts in certain areas and left you uncertain about future salary growth.
advice_to_mgmt: Employees can't live with ambiguity for very long. Being clear on the direction of the firm early on is usually much appreciated.

pros: decent place to work for
cons: not a great career path

review_title: Good compensation but not very stable
pros: Good compensation and benefits package.
cons: Company was sold and a lot of positions were eliminated.

pros: Awesome CEO, nice building, on-site cafeteria and gym
cons: Business was sold and job was eliminated

review_title: I was able to work with a lot of really good people, and enjoyed my time there immensely.
pros: They have a great time-off policy, as well as a great CEO and leadership structure. Everyone works together and it is not a cut throat environment.
cons: The company is in a large period of change, and job roles and leadership have been changing recently. This isn't necessarily bad, but it is different.

review_title: Aviva USA was sold to Athene in October 2013
pros: Aviva USA was a good company.
cons: After Aviva USA was acquired by Athene my position and hundreds of others were eliminated due to restructuring and outsourcing.

review_title: Mediocre investment group and highly political
pros: Paid well to attract talent to Des Moines
cons: The overall talent was way below average

review_title: Scizophrenic insurance carrier in Des Moines
pros: great people and freindly atmosphere
cons: directionally challenged and under-experienced management

review_title: Fulfilling with a lot of opportunities for growth.
pros: Always allowing you to learn new skills and respect your opinions.
cons: Aviva sold out to Athene so the last year was stressful.
advice_to_mgmt: Always be open and honest with your employees. It goes a long way in building trust.

review_title: IT Software Project Manager for Annuity business
pros: Very skilled and knowledgeable software staff. Company supported work/life balance. Great location in downtown Topeka, KS
cons: Frequently being sold. Also plays favorites with employees.
advice_to_mgmt: Convert skilled consultant staff when you've promised to do so.

review_title: Aviva is a great place to work
pros:
Great benefits
Great leadership
Great products
Competitve pay
cons: Changes in management and structure with announced sale.

pros: Great team and work life balanace
cons: Limited avenue for growth and exposure

pros: Lots of good experience at this employer
cons: Changing vision of the company caused layoffs
